intro: Scleria mitis var. subeciliata, commonly known as the slender flatsedge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas, such as marshes and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
